Posts.Content: May 26, 2011 09:10AM AJTAYLOR wrote: Thank you justdiagnosed & Clyn!  Today is a great day!!  I just received a call from the nurse and said my pathology report for my suspicious lymph node biopsy was NEG...  I'm so thankful!  They are setting up my surgery consult for ASAP.  The plan is to have surgery first and revamp the plan according to what is found.  Glad things finally started moving along.  I am so ready to get this started so it will be in my rear view mirror!  ~Hugs to all you wonderful ladies!!
Posts.Title: just diagnosed with bc justdiagnosed AJTAYLOR

Posts.Content: May 25, 2011 09:41AM AJTAYLOR wrote: Hello ladies!! I am new to this sight... Just diagnosed 5/9/11 at age 34 w/ Invasive Mammary Carcinoma.  I am married and have a 7 month old daughter. I am also in the same boat as many of you.  I feel as if I'm in information overload and playing the waiting game. I have been so pro-active in regards to BC... My mom was diagnosed w/ bilateral BC at age 30 & put up a great fight for 13yrs with numerous spreadings.  6 yrs ago I had the BRCA testing & I was negative.  Thought I was in the clear but then this hit me. Since I was diagnosed I have been to a breast specialist at a major cancer hospital... But I don't go back till 6/7/11 and am scared that it is just growing in my body.  I am so anxious to get this started.  My husband & I have decided on the BLMX... They have also talked to us about removing my ovaries as well.  I am thankful to hear all of the encouraging stories and to know chemo is much easier than it used to be.  I am so glad I found this sight & will look forward to reading more encouraging stories.  Hugs to all & keep up the great fight!!
Posts.Title: just diagnosed with bc justdiagnosed AJTAYLOR

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2011 12:32PM AJTAYLOR wrote: Hello to everyone!  I hope all are feeling well and are in good spirits today.  I have not logged on in a week or so... The Dr's that I see are in another state so I have been traveling, trying to keep up w/ work and a newly crawling 7 month old... Life is hectic.  I am so thankful that the Dr's say besides the fact that I have cancer everything about it is in my favor.  My BMX is scheduled for 6/30 and will be starting reconstruction at the same time.  They say a week after my surgery they will have results to see if I need chemo or not.  I am so thankful to read every ones stories and words of encouragement.  Now that a plan is set I do feel more in control.  I also found a thread of others having surgery in June and the stories of recovery are wonderful!  I hope I can check back in again soon!  Take care and hugs to all!!
Posts.Title: just diagnosed with bc justdiagnosed AJTAYLOR

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2011 02:59PM AJTAYLOR wrote: Clyn, I saw on another post that you have had your surgery... Hope you are feeling well.  Please let us know.

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2012 03:00PM AJTAYLOR wrote: This made my heart fill up with joy!!  You look wonderfu and thank you for sharingl!!  I just finished up my chemo last Wednesday and am looking forward to my excahnge surgery.  My goal for this year is to run the 5k BC Awarness in October.  Keep up the great spirits and good health.  :)
Posts.Title: What a difference a year makes jennyboog Yndorian

Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2011 12:31PM AJTAYLOR wrote: Taylor777 I don't post much on the thread but I do read it daily. I saw your question about Taxol... I started with Taxol on 8/4... I will have 12 weekly treatments followed by FAC starting in Oct. every 3rd week for 4 months.  I have had 4 Taxol tx and so far everything is just fine... I told my Onc that I think they gave me saline instead of the med.  The pre-meds are the worst for me... It in a lot of Benadryl whick knocks me out!  My hair did start to thin as my Onc told me it would after tx #3 but you can not tell by looking at me... I'm still holding on to it. Taxol seems to be a breeze compared to the other chemos.  Too bad I'm doing mine in reverse and the worst is yet to come for me.  Good luck today!  Praying for minimal SE's!!  Hugs!! ~Amy
Posts.Title: August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie

Posts.Content: Jul 29, 2011 03:35PM AJTAYLOR wrote: Thank you Madismommy! Our daughter is a joy and makes everything better at the end of the day.  Last August 4th I was put on bed rest to keep the pregnancy and this August 4th is my first chemo. We live in a neighborhood of 26 kids under the age of 13... We are very close, like family and spend time together every weekend.  I was concerned about the kids when I lose my hair or was sick.  I told the parents that I wouldn't answer any of the kids questions (in case I said the wrong thing).  They have found books on how to explain it to the kids and say they are very good.  Have a wonderful weekend!!  My hubby is taking me out on a date tonight since we start chemo next week :) ~Amy
Posts.Title: August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie

Posts.Content: Jul 29, 2011 01:56PM AJTAYLOR wrote: I'm joining in the August group. Start 12 x weekly Taxol August 4th then followed by FAC every 3rd week for 4 months.  I've been snooping around on the boards for a while and thought it was time to post.  I have a 9 month old daughter and am so thankful that she is not aware that mommy is sick... She will only hear stories of this when she is older.  I have an amazing husband and support group that will be fighting right along w/ me!  Even though they are as wonderful as can be, they do not understand the feelings and have answers like you all do.  I look forward to reading more posts and encouraging eachother along this journey. *Everyday may not be good but there is something good in everyday* ~Amy
Posts.Title: August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie
